scenarios.description:
5AAA 2B hjc.9 j.2B/j.5B j.66/D6/D3 j.5A Dial A |
Common Midscreen BnB.
Doesn't work on midgets and most crouching
characters.
scenarios.name: 5AAA starter 1

scenarios.description:
5AAA d623B j.5B j.66 j.6A |
Doesn't work on a lot of characters,
but can be fixed by dashing into the opponent
before starting 5A.
The additional momentum will
make the combo work on small characters like
standing Youmu as well,
but will still drop on small crouches.
Also works in the corner.
scenarios.name: 5AAA starter 2

scenarios.description:
5AAA 2B[1] 5C hj.9 j.6C |
5AAA alt route for midgets.
j.6C can be replaced for d236B
but only from midscreen.
scenarios.name: 5AAA starter 3

scenarios.description:
f.5A/2A 3A 66B |
Combo options after f5A and 2A
from far without CH are limited to 3A
scenarios.name: f.5A/2A starter

scenarios.description:
6A 2B hj.9 j.6A |
j.6A ender is a decent corner carry,
however you might land behind your enemy.
Also works in the corner.
scenarios.name: 6A starter

scenarios.description:
f.5A/2A 6A 2B d623B |
Simple BnB 6A,
Which can combo after a f5A or 2A CH.
scenarios.name: f.5A/2A CH starter

scenarios.description:
6A 5C hjc.9 j.5A j.6A j.6C |
Sometimes when you try a 6A 5C corner carry
during pressure, the 6A gets a CH,
in which case you can do this combo.
scenarios.name: 6A CH Starter

scenarios.description:
66A d623B j.5B j.66 j.6A |
Sakuya's only meterless
combo option after hitting 66A.
66A needs to hit deep enough
or 623B won't connect.
Make sure that all B knives come out,
otherwise it won't limit.
If your opponent ends up too high,
finish with j.6C instead.
scenarios.name: 66A starter

scenarios.description:
3A hj.9 j.5A j.6A j.6C |
Mostly used to combo off of an airtech punish.
Timing is quite strict and depending
on the distance to your enemy
this combo easily drops.
Way easier if the opponent is caught
in the air with 3A as an anti-air combo.
Also works in the corner,
but use j5B/j2B/j2C as finisher.
scenarios.name: 3A starter

scenarios.description: j.2B D2 j.2B D3 Dial A | Universal j2B starter
scenarios.name: j2B starter

scenarios.description:
Dial A hj.9 j.5A j.6A j.2B D2/D1 |
Universal BnB D2 to setup oki.
scenarios.name: Dial A Corner starter

scenarios.description:
j.2A j.9 j.5A j.2A 66A d623B |
Basic corner combo ender for most characters.
You will often get this starter
as j.2A is a great frametrap option.
scenarios.name: j.2A Corner starter

scenarios.description:
f.5A/2A 3A j.5A j.2A 66A d623B |
You can omit f.5A/2A.
Mostly used to combo off of an airtech punish.
You can also leave out the finisher (66A d623B)
and try to bait another airtech,
essentially resetting this combo into itself.
scenarios.name: (f.5A/2A)3A Corner starter

scenarios.description:
3A j.9 j.5A j.2A j9 j.2A 66A d623B |
In case you only hit the second part of 3A,
useful if the opponent is too far
scenarios.name: 3A[1] Corner anti-air starter

scenarios.description:
5AAA 2B hjc.9 j.6A j.6C |
Works off of a low 4A anti-air.
If your opponent is too high,
you should rather go for the chase.
scenarios.name: 5AAA Corner anti-air starter

scenarios.description:
6A 6C hj.9 j.5A j.6C j.66 j.5A j.6A |
More damaging variant of the basic 6A,
will however drop if started with CH f.5A.
Also works some distance away from the corner.
Ender can be replaced by j2A 66A d623B,
for easier execution.
scenarios.name: 6A Corner starter

scenarios.description:
j.5A j.2A j.9 j.5A j.2A 66A d623B |
Optimized version of the corner BnB.
scenarios.name: j.5A Corner starter

scenarios.description:
5AAAA j.9 j.2A 66A d623B |
Near corner, spacing specific dial A combo.
Gives good damage and okizeme.
scenarios.name: Dial A Near-Corner starter

scenarios.description:
j.6A hj.9 j.5A j.2A 66A 623B |
Optimized j6A land cancel near corner.
If you're close enough.
scenarios.name: j.6A LC Near corner

scenarios.description:
j.5A j.6C j.6D/j.66 j.6C j.d236B|
Basic air-to-air j5A combo.
Delay the j236b. Pray it limits.
scenarios.name: j.5A Air starter

scenarios.description:
j.5A j.6A j.6C j.d236B |
Basic air-to-air j5A combo.
Delay the j236b. Pray it limits.
scenarios.name: j.5A/j.6A Air starter

scenarios.description:
j.6A j.6C j.66/j.D6 j.6C j.D9 j.6C |
Another basic air-to-air j.6A combo.
scenarios.name: j.6A Air starter

scenarios.description:
j.8A j.5B j.9D/j.66 j.6A/j.8A |
j.8A combo near-corner/corner.
scenarios.name: j.8A Air starter

scenarios.description:
66C hj.9/hj.8/j.8/j.9 j.2A 66C |
Midscreen conversion off 66C CH.
Spacing on hit changes the timing a lot.
You can try to adjust using D6.
You can go for the 66A ender,
if you're close enough to the corner.
scenarios.name: 66C CH starter

scenarios.description:
66C hj.9/hj.8/j.8/j.9 j.5A j.6A j.6C |
Alt route for midscreen conversion off 66C CH.
It can be easier to hit depending on your
spacing and the opponent height.
scenarios.name: 66C CH starter 2

scenarios.description:
66C hj.9/D6 j.5A j.2A 66A d623B |
More optimized combo off of 66C CH.
If you move into the corner due to 66C,
you have to walk back a little,
otherwise you will be facing out of the corner.
scenarios.name: 66C CH starter Near-Corner

scenarios.description:
5AAA 2B hj.9 j.5C D6 j.5A 5AAAA |
Near corner, More optimized version with 5A
starter.
scenarios.name: 5AAA Near-Corner starter

scenarios.description:
5AAA 2B(1) 5C hj.9 j.5A j.2B D3/j.66 j.5A Dial A |
Variations of 5A BnB for tall characters.
scenarios.name: 5A Corner starter
